title: Resolution Recognizing and Upholding the Zero Waste Mission Commitment
sponsor: Deputy Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Senator Oscar Santiago, Senator Spencer Gorelick, Senator Adrianne Weston, Senator Lila Terner, Senator Hiba Karim, Judiciary Chairwoman Casey Mason, Senate President Pro-Tempore Fineberg, Senate President Groux, Judiciary Vice Chair Sean Harkins, Majority Party Leader John Brinkman, Senator Andrew Priest, Senator Ryan Rosenfelt, Senator Mason Solomon, Senator Taylor Soukup
author: Minority Party Leader Gabrielle Adekunle
summary: On August 31st, 2021, the City of Gainesville Zero Waste Subcommittee implemented an updated solid waste ordinance to further their zero waste mission. This resolution recognizes and upholds the commitment to the zero waste mission. This commitment is aimed at reducing waste, promoting recycling, and ensuring sustainability within the city. The resolution acknowledges the efforts of the City of Gainesville in addressing and implementing this ordinance. It also encourages residents, businesses, and organizations to actively participate in achieving the city's zero waste goals. By passing this resolution, the Student Senate shows support and commitment to the efforts of the City of Gainesville towards achieving a sustainable and environmentally-friendly community.

title: Resolution Commemorating Black History Month
sponsor: Deputy Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Rules & Ethics Chairwoman Camille Consolo, Senator Oscar Santiago, Senator Olivia Green, Senator Spencer Gorelick, Senator Connor Panish, Senator Ethan Sawyer, Senator Andrew Fenning, Senator Kyle Fohrman, Senator Adrianne Weston, Senator Brendan Lamboglia, Judiciary Vice Chair Sean Harkins

title: Exclusionary Offices Modernization Act - 100 Codes Amendment
sponsor: Minority Party Leader Gabrielle Adekunie, Deputy Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Senator Spencer Gorelick, Senator Connor Panish
author: Senator Oscar Santiago
summary: The Exclusionary Offices Modernization Act - 100 Codes Amendment aims to amend Chapter 130 of the Exclusionary Offices Act to update and modernize the list of exclusionary offices in the Executive Branch. The amendment includes additions and revisions to the list of exclusive offices, such as Student Body President, Student Body Vice President, Student Body Treasurer, Assistant Treasurer(s), Executive Secretary, etc. The purpose of this amendment is to ensure that the list of exclusionary offices accurately reflects the current structure and needs of the Student Senate and Executive Branch.

title: Project ReOrganization (PRO) Act
sponsor: Student Body President Cooper Brown, Majority Party Leader Emily Pecora, Senate President Lizzie Hartzog, Senate President Pro-Tempore Olivia Green, Senator Giordano
author: Judiciary Vice Chair Sean Harkins, Senator John Brinkman
summary: Student Senate Bill 2022-1006, titled the Project ReOrganization (PRO) Act, is authored by Judiciary Vice Chair Sean Harkins and Senator John Brinkman. The bill is sponsored by Student Body President Cooper Brown, Majority Party Leader Emily Pecora, Senate President Lizzie Hartzog, Senate President Pro-Tempore Olivia Green, and Senator Giordano. The bill proposes amendments to Chapter 210 of the Student Senate's rules, specifically addressing the Executive Branch Officials. The purpose of the PRO Act is to reorganize and streamline the roles and responsibilities of the Executive Branch Officials to improve efficiency and effectiveness within the Student Senate.

title: Resolution Recognizing May as Mental Health Awareness Month 2022
sponsor:
Senator Connor Panish, Senator Cassie Urbenz, Senator Faith Corbett, Minority
Party Leader Gabrielle Adekunle
author: Senator Gabriela Montes, Senator Oscar Santiago
summary: In 1949, the Mental Health America Organization designated the month of May as “Mental Health Awareness Month”. The purpose of this month is to increase awareness of the importance of mental health and wellness in Americans' lives, and to celebrate recovery from mental illness. The bill recognizes May as Mental Health Awareness Month in 2022.

title: Resolution Acknowledging the Conclusion of Asian Pacific Islander Desi American (APIDA) Heritage Month
sponsor: Senate President Elizabeth Hartzog, Senate President Pro-Tempore Olivia Green, Judiciary Chairman John Brinkman, Budget and Appropriations Chairwoman Catherine Giordano, Majority Party Leader Emily Pecora, Senator Krish Talati, Senator Aneesh Chatrathi, Senator Hana Ali, Senator Anjali Natarajan, Senator Ryan Athay, Senator Johnny Liu, Senator Timothy Shin
author: Senator Saketh Damera
summary: As designated by the Government of the United States of America, APIDA Heritage Month is observed and celebrated during the month of May. The Student Senate acknowledges the conclusion of this important month and recognizes the contributions, achievements, and cultural diversity of the Asian Pacific Islander Desi American community. Through this resolution, the Senate expresses its support for the APIDA community and commits to promoting inclusivity, understanding, and awareness within the university. The Senate encourages continued education and engagement in order to foster a more inclusive and equitable campus environment.

sponsor: Deputy Minority Party Leader Mohammed Faisal, Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Senator Oscar Santiago-Perez

summary: Composting is the natural process of recycling organic matter, such as leaves and food scraps, into a valuable fertilizer that can enrich soil and plants. The resolution advocates for the expansion of composting stations across the campus.

sponsor: Senator Jonathan Stephens, Senator Oscar Santiago, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Catherine Gomez, Senator Taylor Hoerle, Senator Isabelle Gerzenshtein, Senator Hana Ali, Senator Savanah Partridge, Deputy Minority Party Leader Mohammed Faisal, Member-at-Large Jacey Cable, Judiciary Vice-Chair Mason Solomon, Senator Bronson Allemand, Senator Saketh Damera, Senator Jacob Ka

title: Senate Meeting Modernization and Reform Act of 2022
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chairman Mason Solomon, Senator Mara Vaknin, Senator Julia Haley, Senator Taylor Soukup, Member-at-Large Jacey Cable, Senator Jagger Leach, Senator Sidney Ruedas
author: Judiciary Chairman John Brinkman
summary: This bill, authored by Judiciary Chairman John Brinkman, aims to modernize and reform Senate meetings by proposing amendments to Rule I, which governs the officers of the Senate. The key change includes a revised process for electing the Senate President immediately after validating Senate election results. The bill's objective is to enhance efficiency and transparency in Senate meetings.

sponsor: Senator Evan Asuncion, Senator Jonathan C. Stephens, Senator Ryan Athay, Senator Hana Ali, Senator Anjali Natarajan
author: Senator Oscar Santiago
summary: Amendment Awareness Act - Rules and Procedures Amendment. Written amendments to legislation must be submitted to the Senate President and Senate Secretary no later than 11:59 PM ET the day before the meeting of the Senate at which the amendment is to be heard.

sponsor: Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Deputy Minority Party Leader Mohammed Faisal
author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: This bill, titled Student Senate Secretary Clerical Intensification Amendment, is authored by Senator Jonathan C. Stephens. It has Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett and Deputy Minority Party Leader Mohammed Faisal as sponsors. The bill proposes an amendment to the CHAPTER 301 CODING SYSTEM of the Student Senate, which pertains to the labeling and numbering of proposals. The purpose of this amendment is to enhance the clerical process and organization of the Student Senate Secretary's office.

title: Funding for Fiscal Year 2023-2024 Activity and Service Fee Budget
sponsor: Budget and Appropriations Committee
author: Budget and Appropriations Chairwoman Catherine Giordano
summary: This bill, authored by Budget and Appropriations Chairwoman Catherine Giordano, proposes funding for the Fiscal Year 2023-2024 Activity and Service Fee Budget. The total budget is $23,251,863.00, representing a 3% increase. The budget includes allocations for Recreational Sports ($7,506,043.00), Reitz Union ($6,529,681.00), Sorority & Fraternity Life ($720,137.00), Student Activities & Involvement ($1,963,611.00), and Student Government ($6,532,391.00). Within the Recreational Sports budget, there is an increase in personnel funding of $393,703.00 from the previous fiscal year.

title: Censuring Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
sponsor: Rules and Ethics Committee
author: Rules and Ethics Chairwoman Tanner Thompson
summary: During the May 24th, 2022 regular Senate meeting Senator Stephens was observed making a physical hand motion that was interpreted by many as an offensive act toward those who live with disabilities. During the July 5, 2022 regular Senate meeting Senator Stephens once again routinely interrupted the business of the Senate and was issued two warnings by the Senate President. Pursuant to Rule XIII § (1)(a)(ii), Senators may be censured for repeatedly disrupting the business of the Senate.

title: Leadership Update Notice Guarantee Act (LUNGA)
sponsor: None
author: Senator Jonathan Chance Stephens
summary: The Student Senate, with a majority vote, may postpone the approval of appointments by one week to review the applicants. The Student Senate shall not confirm any selection for an exclusionary office or position if the appointing officer has not submitted a resume and application to the Replacement and Agenda Committee for compulsory review of stipulated qualifications prior to the Student Senate.

title: STUDENT ORGANIZATION FUNDRAISING ACCOUNTS -— 800 CODES
sponsor: Budget and Appropriations Committee
author: Budget and Appropriationns Chairwoman Catherine Giordano
summary: To keep an outside revenue account, student organizations must: Continue to be actively funded through Student Government once per fiscal year. Have at least $50.00 in the outside revenue account at the end of each fiscal year. Actively use the outside revenue account, with at least one transaction within the last two fiscal years.

title: Legislative Branch Exclusionary Offices Amendment - 100 Codes Revision
author: Senator Oscar Santiago
summary: The Legislative Branch Exclusionary Offices Amendment revises the 100 Codes in Chapter 130 of the Exclusionary Offices Act. The amendment includes the exclusionary offices of Student Senator, Senate Secretary, Senate Parliamentarian, and Senate Sergeant-at-Arms.

title: Senate Reapportionment Act of 2023
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chair Mason Solomon, Member-at-Large Jacey Cable, Senator Taylor Soukup, Senator Mara Vaknin, Senator Julia Haley, Senator Sidney Ruedas
author: Judiciary Chairman John Brinkman
summary: This bill, authored by Judiciary Chairman John Brinkman, proposes the Senate Reapportionment Act of 2023. The bill aims to modify the apportionment of seats in the Senate. The sponsors of this bill include Judiciary Vice-Chair Mason Solomon, Member-at-Large Jacey Cable, Senator Taylor Soukup, Senator Mara Vaknin, Senator Julia Haley, and Senator Sidney Ruedas.

title: Resolution Acknowledging International Student Achievements and Equality Among the Student Body
sponsor: Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Deputy Minority Party Leader Gabriela Montes, Senator Cassandra Urbenz, Senator Oscar Santiago, Senator Ryan Athay
author: Senator Hana Ali, Senator Grace Shoemaker
summary: The University of Florida acknowledges the achievements and equality among its international student body, which consists of over 6,000 students from 140 countries. The top six countries of origin for international students are India, China, South Korea, Taiwan, Brazil, and Venezuela. International students often face various challenges, including language barriers, cultural adjustment, and financial burdens. The University of Florida strives to support and empower its international students to ensure their success and inclusivity within the student body. This resolution aims to recognize and appreciate the contributions and accomplishments of international students at the University of Florida.

title: Resolution Affirming the Importance of Free Expression and Civil Discourse
sponsor: Senator Mason Solomon
author: Judiciary Chairman John Brinkman, Judiciary Vice Chair Sean Harkins, Senator Shelby Schultz, Member-at-Large Jacey Cable
summary: Florida Board of Governors Chair Syd Kitson established the Board's Civil Discourse Initiative at an address in January 2021, where he expressed concern regarding the steady decline in respectful discourse among those with differing viewpoints and his belief that the university setting could provide a foundation for understanding, learning, and growth in this area. The resolution affirms the importance of free expression and civil discourse and recognizes the value in promoting open dialogue and respectful exchange of ideas. The resolution also calls upon all members of the University of Florida community to uphold these principles and engage in constructive and inclusive conversations.

title: Resolution Recognizing October as Breast Cancer Awareness Month
sponsor: Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Deputy Minority Leader Gabriela Montes, Senator Grace Shoemaker, Senate President Elizabeth Hartzog, Senate Pro Tempore Olivia Green, Judiciary Chairman John Brinkman, Budget and Appropriations Chairwoman Catherine Giordano, Rules and Ethics Chairwoman Tanner Thompson, Information and Communications Chairwoman Phoebe Funai, Majority Party Leader Emily Pecora, Member-at-Large Nyla Pierre, Senator Sidney Ruedas, Senator Shelby Schultz, Senator Haley Rubin, Senator Alejandro Hoyos, Senator Sean Ha
author: Senator Oscar Santiago
summary: Resolution Recognizing October as Breast Cancer Awareness Month

title: Resolution Recognizing the Disability and Mental Health Resource Crisis at the University of Florida
summary: The University of Florida Student Senate recognizes the disability and mental health resource crisis at the university. This resolution aims to bring attention to the lack of resources available to students with disabilities and mental health conditions, and urges the administration to take immediate action to address this issue. The Student Senate calls for increased funding and support for disability services, mental health counseling, and accessibility accommodations in order to ensure a more inclusive and supportive campus environment for all students. The resolution also emphasizes the importance of raising awareness and reducing stigma surrounding disability and mental health.

sponsor: Majority Party Leader Blake Cox, Senator Kathryn Holmes, Senator Danny Wolcott, Senator Joaquin Rafaele Marcelino, Senator Pari Patel, Senator Savanah Partridge, Senator Miranda Holder, Senator John Rassel, Senator Jorge Perez, Senator Grace Shoemaker, Senator Cassie Urbenz, Senator Danny Kopelman, Senator Bianca Barri

summary: Resolution Acknowledging the Impact of Hurricane Ian in Southwest Florida

title: Student Senate Discovery Period Assurance Initiative (SSDPAI)
sponsor: Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Deputy Minority Party Leader Gabriela Montes, Senator Cassandra Urbenz, Senator Nathan McGinnis, Senator John Rassel, Senator Joaquin Rafaele Marcelino, Senator Hana Ali, Senator Savanah Partridge, Senator Connor Panish, Senator Mohammed Faisal
author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: The Student Senate Discovery Period Assurance Initiative (SSDPAI) is a bill proposed by Senator Jonathan C. Stephens. It aims to provide assurance and support for the discovery period of the Student Senate. The initiative is sponsored by Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Deputy Minority Party Leader Gabriela Montes, Senator Cassandra Urbenz, Senator Nathan McGinnis, Senator John Rassel, Senator Joaquin Rafaele Marcelino, Senator Hana Ali, Senator Savanah Partridge, Senator Connor Panish, and Senator Mohammed Faisal.

title: Senate Post-Recess Attendance Initiative (SPRAI)
sponsor: Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Senator Nathan McGinnis, Senator Joaquin Rafaele Marcellino, Senator Savanah Partridge, Senator Mohammed Faisal
author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: This bill, titled Senate Post-Recess Attendance Initiative (SPRAI), is authored by Senator Jonathan C. Stephens with sponsorship from Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Senator Nathan McGinnis, Senator Joaquin Rafaele Marcellino, Senator Savanah Partridge, and Senator Mohammed Faisal. The bill proposes amendments to Rule IV of the University of Florida Student Senate's attendance policy. These amendments aim to address post-recess attendance and roll call procedures. The bill outlines the responsibilities of the Chair of the Rules and Ethics Committee (or Vice-Chair in the Chair's absence) in conducting roll calls and designates the Senate President to call the roll if no members of the Rules and Ethics Committee are present. This initiative seeks to improve attendance tracking and promote transparency in the Senate's operations.

title: Resolution Condemning “The Johns Committee”
sponsor: Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Deputy Minority Party Leader Gabriela Montes, Senator Navya Nair, Senator Connor Panish, Senator Joaquin Rafaele Cecilia Marcelino, Senator Evan Asuncion, Senator Wavid Bowman, Senator Hana Ali, Senator Grace Shoemaker, Senator Mohammed Faisal, Senator John Rassel
author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: The Florida Legislative Investigation Committee (FLIC, better known as the “Johns Committee”, under the direction of former senator Charley E. Johns, was created in 1956. This resolution condemns the actions and practices of the Johns Committee, which engaged in McCarthyite tactics and violated the civil rights of individuals under the pretense of investigating communist activities. The Student Senate expresses its commitment to upholding the principles of equality, justice, and freedom, and stands against any form of discrimination or repression.

title: Resolution Encouraging University of Florida Students to Vote in the 2022 Midterm Elections
sponsor: Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Senator Jonathan C. Stephens, Senator Cassandra Urbenz, Senator Anjali Natarajan, Senator Luke Asuncion, Senator Oscar Santiago Perez, Senator John Rassel, Senator Danny Wolcott, Senator Mohammed Faisal, Senator Mason Solomon
author: Senator Evan Asuncion, Senator Connor Panish, Senator Navya Nair
summary: The University of Florida Student Senate encourages students to vote in the 2022 United States Midterm Elections. These elections provide an opportunity for registered Florida voters to cast their votes for various government positions, including a Florida U.S. Senator and the Governor. Voting is a fundamental right that allows individuals to contribute to the democratic process and have a say in shaping the future of their communities. By exercising their right to vote, University of Florida students can actively participate in decision-making processes and voice their opinions on important issues. The Student Senate recognizes the importance of civic engagement and encourages student involvement in the upcoming elections.

title: Resolution in Solidarity With the Women of Iran
sponsor: Deputy Minority Leader Gabriela Montes, Senator Jonathan C. Stephens, Senator Ibrahim Siddiqui, Senator Nathan McGinnis, Senator Katie Holmes, Senator Anjali Natarajan, Senator Navya Nair, Senator Joaquin Rafaele Cecilia Marcelino, Senator Evan Asuncion, Senator John Rassel
author: Senator Danny Wolcott
summary: Mahsa Amini was killed by the Iranian Morality Police for not properly adhering to Iran’s dress regulations in September of 2022. The women of Iran have been bravely protesting daily for their rights and freedoms since September 17th, 2022.

title: Senate Town Hall Explanation, Verification, and Implementation Act (STHEVIA)
sponsor: Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Senator Oscar Santiago Perez, Senator Grace Shoemaker, Senator Mohammed Faisal, Senator John Rassel, Senator Wavid Bowman, Judiciary Chairman Sean Harkins, Rules and Ethics Chairwoman Lilliana Clark, Senator Mason Solomon, Senator Aaron Amster, Senator Bianca Barrios, Senator Wilson Roberts, Senator Haley Rubin, Senator Saketh Damera, Senator Brendan Kligerman
author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: The Senate Town Hall Explanation, Verification, and Implementation Act (STHEVIA) proposes the CHAPTER 324 STUDENT SENATOR ACCOUNTABILITY ACT, sponsored by Senator Jonathan C. Stephens and supported by various senators. This act aims to enhance accountability for student senators by providing a mechanism for explanation, verification, and implementation of their actions. It ensures that student senators uphold their responsibilities and serve the student body effectively. Through this act, the Student Senate aims to maintain transparency and integrity in its actions and decisions.

title: Statute Technical Expansion and Clarity Act - Volume | (STECA v1)
sponsor: Senator Mohammed Faisal, Senator John Rassel
author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: This bill, titled the Statute Technical Expansion and Clarity Act - Volume | (STECA v1), aims to provide technical expansion and clarity to the existing statutes of the Student Body. It proposes amendments to Chapter 100 of the Student Body Statutes, which covers the system of the Student Body. The bill organizes the statutes into titles and chapters based on subject matter and ensures a coherent and comprehensible structure. The primary objective of the bill is to enhance the accessibility and usability of the Student Body Statutes.

title: Statute Technical Expansion and Clarity Act — Volume 2 (STECA v2)
sponsor: Senator Mohammed Faisal, Senator John Rassel
author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: The Statute Technical Expansion and Clarity Act — Volume 2 (STECA v2) is a bill authored by Senator Jonathan C. Stephens. It aims to expand and clarify certain statutes in order to improve transparency. The bill proposes amendments to Chapter 131 of THE POLITICAL CORRESPONDENCE TRANSPARENCY ACT, which deals with political correspondence. It defines terms such as 'political correspondence' and 'relative' and establishes guidelines for communication between public officials and candidates for public office. The bill is sponsored by Senator Mohammed Faisal and Senator John Rassel.

title: Statute Technical Expansion and Clarity Act — Volume 3 (STECA v3)
sponsor: Senator Mohammed Faisal, Senator John Rassel
author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: The Statute Technical Expansion and Clarity Act (STECA v3) is a bill authored by Senator Jonathan C. Stephens and sponsored by Senator Mohammed Faisal and Senator John Rassel. The bill aims to provide technical expansion and clarity to existing statutes. It specifically focuses on Chapter 236, the Complimentary Ticket Act, which regulates the distribution of complimentary tickets for events organized by ACCENT and Student Government Productions. The bill requires the responsible officers of these organizations to submit accurate and complete lists of individuals receiving complimentary tickets for events under their control. This will ensure transparency and accountability in the ticket distribution process.

title: Statute Technical Expansion and Clarity Act — Volume 4 (STECA v4)
sponsor: Senator Mohammed Faisal, Senator John Rassel
author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: This bill, titled Statute Technical Expansion and Clarity Act — Volume 4 (STECA v4), is authored by Senator Jonathan C. Stephens and sponsored by Senator Mohammed Faisal and Senator John Rassel. The bill proposes amendments and clarifications to existing statutes, specifically Chapter 503, related to the selection and term of office of non-voting student delegates to the Faculty Senate. The bill aims to improve technical aspects of the statutes and ensure clarity in the selection process and term duration of the student delegates.

title: Statute Technical Expansion and Clarity Act - Volume 5 (STECA v5)
sponsor: Senator Mohammed Faisal, Senator John Rassel
author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: Statute Technical Expansion and Clarity Act - Volume 5 (STECA v5) is a bill introduced by Senator Jonathan C. Stephens. The bill aims to provide technical expansion and clarity to existing statutes. It has been sponsored by Senator Mohammed Faisal and Senator John Rassel. The bill seeks to improve transparency and efficiency in the legislative process. It will be enacted if not vetoed within 10 days.

title: Resolution Condemning the Rise in Antisemitism
sponsor: Senate President Olivia Green, Majority Party Leader Cox, Senator Aaron Amster, Senator Ethan Ghozali, Senate President Pro-Tempore Catherine Giordano, Senator Santiago Alvarez, Senator Nyla Pierre, Member at-Large Ana Carolina Troncoso, Senator Joah Levine, Senator Danny Kopelman, Senator Jake Weiner, Senator Clayton Bush, Senator Julia Seifer, Member at-Large Mara Vaknin, Senator Brett Barnett, Senator Shelby Schultz, Senator Presley Baesler, Senator Mason Solomon, Senator Samuel Rosenkranz

summary: Resolution Condemning the Rise in Antisemitism authored by Judiciary Chairman Sean Harkins, Senator Brendan Kligerman, Senator Haley Rubin and sponsored by Senate President Olivia Green, Majority Party Leader Cox, Senator Aaron Amster, Senator Ethan Ghozali, Senate President Pro-Tempore Catherine Giordano, Senator Santiago Alvarez, Senator Nyla Pierre, Member at-Large Ana Carolina Troncoso, Senator Joah Levine, Senator Danny Kopelman, Senator Jake Weiner, Senator Clayton Bush, Senator Julia Seifer, Member at-Large Mara Vaknin, Senator Brett Barnett, Senator Shelby Schultz, Senator Presley Baesler, Senator Mason Solomon, Senator Samuel Rosenkranz. The resolution condemns the rise in antisemitism.

title: Gender Neutral Wording Act Vol. 2 - 300 Codes Revision
sponsor: Senator Nathan McGinnis, Senator Wavid Bowman, Senator John Rassel, Senator Cable, Senator Levine, Judiciary Chairman Sean Harkins, Senator Mason Solomon, Senator Haley Rubin, Senator Liam Antoswezki, Senator Wilson Roberts, Senator Hana Ali, Senator Joaquin Rafaele Cecilia Marcelino, Senator Navya Nair
author: LGBTQ+ Caucus Chair Oscar Santiago Perez

title: Resolution Commemorating November as American Native Heritage Month
sponsor: Senator Jonathan Chance Stephens, Senator Nyla Pierre, Senator Mimi Abrucia, Senator Nathan McGinnis, Senator Anjali Natarajan, Senator Joaquin Rafaele Cecilia Marcelino, Senator Julia Seifer, Senator John Rassel, Senator Hana Ali, Senator Ashley Shakib, Deputy Minority Party Leader Gabriela Montes, Senator Oscar Santiago Perez, Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Senator Miranda Holder, Senator Connor Panish
author: Senator Cassie Urbenz
summary: On August 3, 1990, President of the United States George H. W. Bush declared the month of November as National American Indian Heritage Month, also known as American Native Heritage Month. The University of Florida Student Senate recognizes and commemorates this important celebration of the rich cultural heritage, traditions, contributions, and history of Native Americans. Through this resolution, the Senate acknowledges the significant impact of Native American individuals, tribes, and communities in shaping the United States. The Senate encourages the University of Florida community to engage in educational and cultural activities that promote understanding, respect, and appreciation for Native American heritage throughout the month of November. Furthermore, the Senate urges all members of the university to participate in events, programs, and initiatives that promote dialogue, awareness, and celebration of Native American cultures.

title: Resolution Recognizing October as LGBTQIA+ History Month
sponsor: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens, Deputy Minority Party Leader Gabriela Montes, Senator Nathan McGinnis, Senator Hana Ali, Senator Wavid Bowman, Senator John Rassel, Senator Cassie Urbenz, LGBTQ+ Caucus Chair Oscar Santiago Perez
author: Senator Joaquin Rafaele Cecilia Marcelino
summary: The University of Florida Student Senate recognizes October as LGBTQIA+ History Month. This resolution acknowledges the active efforts made by the Senate to support and acknowledge the LGBTQIA+ community at the University of Florida. It also highlights the history of restrictions on LGBTQ+ rights and freedoms at the national and state level, emphasizing the need for continued advocacy and support for LGBTQ+ individuals. The resolution is sponsored by Senator Jonathan C. Stephens, Deputy Minority Party Leader Gabriela Montes, Senator Nathan McGinnis, Senator Hana Ali, Senator Wavid Bowman, Senator John Rassel, Senator Cassie Urbenz, and LGBTQ+ Caucus Chair Oscar Santiago Perez.

summary: UF Student Senate Bill 2022-1063 advocates for expanded hybrid parking decals on the University of Florida campus in response to growing concerns about student parking. The resolution is authored by Senator Cassie Urbenz, Senator John Rassel, Senator Joaquin Rafaele Cecilia Marcelino, and Senator Jonathan Chance Stephens. title: Resolution Advocating for Expanded Access to Gender Affirming Care in the State of Florida
sponsor: Minority Party Leader Faith Corbett, Senator Connor Panish
author: Senator Joaquin Rafaele Cecilia Marcelino, Senator Oscar Santiago Perez, Senator Cassie Urbenz, Senator Anaum Virani, Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: The Student Senate advocates for expanded access to gender-affirming care in the state of Florida. Gender-affirming care includes social, psychological, behavioral, and medical interventions that support and affirm an individual's gender identity. Research shows that gender-affirming care improves the mental health and well-being of transgender individuals. The resolution calls for policies and legislation that promote affordable and accessible gender-affirming care for all residents of Florida. It also recognizes the importance of healthcare providers receiving proper training on transgender healthcare. The Student Senate urges lawmakers and healthcare organizations to take action to ensure that everyone has access to the care they need to affirm their gender identity.

author: Senator Oscar Santiago Perez, Senator Jonathan C. Stephens

summary: UF Student Senate Bill 2023-1027 calls for the immediate reversal of the plans to close and demolish Maguire Village and University Village South (UVS) Graduate and Family Housing Facilities. The resolution highlights the recent earthquake in southern Turkey and northern Syria, which resulted in significant casualties. The resolution further emphasizes the importance of these housing facilities in providing necessary housing for graduate students and families. The resolution is supported by multiple sponsors and seeks to protect the well-being and housing needs of the UF community.

title: Resolution Calling for the Immediate Reversal of the Plans to Close and Demolish Maguire Village and University Village South (UVS) Graduate and Family Housing Facilities
sponsor: Minority Party Leader Gabriela Montes, Senator Grace Shoemaker, Senator Cole Hautamaki
author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: On March of 2021, the University of Florida Board of Trustees approved the Campus Development Agreement that included the demolition of Maguire Village and University Village South [1]. Maguire Village and University Village South, better known as UVS, are two of the five dedicated graduate housing facilitates under the terminology 'Villages'. The University of Florida Student Senate passed unanimously Resolution 2021-1029, calling for an immediate reversal of the plans to close and demolish these housing facilities.

The Student Body Treasurer will be responsible for the implementation of this act.

author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: Student Senate Bill 2023-1034 proposes the implementation of the Student Government Statute Cover Page Accessibility Initiative (SGSAI). The bill aims to compile all Student Body Laws of permanent effect and general public interest, or of legal or historical significance, into a codification known as Student Body Statutes. This compilation will include the constitution in its entirety and all by-laws of the Student Senate. The purpose of the initiative is to ensure accessibility and ease of reference for the student body.

The STECAv6 will be enacted if not vetoed within 10 days of its proposal.

The objective of this bill is to enhance the understanding and applicability of the statutes.

summary: Senate Resolution to Protect Bright Futures for All Majors. The resolution is authored by Senator Nathaniel Pelton and sponsored by Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez, Senate President Pro Tempore Nathan McGinnis, Majority Party Leader Evan Rafanan, and several other senators. The resolution aims to ensure that Bright Futures scholarships are available to students across all majors. It highlights the importance of supporting students' academic pursuits and acknowledges the significant impact of Bright Futures on students' educational opportunities. The resolution emphasizes the value of a diverse range of majors and the positive contribution they make to society. The Student Senate intends to advocate for equal access to Bright Futures scholarships for all students, regardless of their chosen field of study.

title: Resolution Advocating for Activity and Service Fee Relief for Graduate Assistants
sponsor: Senator Anghelo Gangano, Senator Caitlyn Mathews, Senator Anna Huber, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Jorge Perez, Senator Simone Liang, Senator Nathaniel Pelton, Senator Colin Lasch, Senator John Lin

summary: Graduate Assistants, who are graduate students with part-time teaching or research duties, are facing rising costs of living. This resolution advocates for activity and service fee relief for Graduate Assistants to alleviate financial burden and support their academic pursuits. The University of Florida Student Senate recognizes the importance of providing affordable resources for Graduate Assistants and their contributions to the university. By implementing fee relief measures, the university can create a supportive environment that promotes the success and well-being of Graduate Assistants.

title: Resolution Opposing the State Takeover of the Gainesville Regional Utilities Authority
sponsor: Senator Joaquin Rafaele C. Marcelino, Senator Nathaniel Pelton, Senator JohnLin, Senator Anghelo Gangano, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Jorge Perez, Senator Arunabho Basu
author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: On April 10th, 2023, Florida State Representative Chuck Clemons filed Florida House Bill 1645 that would shift the authority of the Gainesville Regional Utilities (GRU) from the City of Gainesville Commission’s control to the Governor’s control. The Student Senate opposes this state takeover and supports maintaining the control of GRU under the City of Gainesville Commission.

title: Vacancy Replacement Revision
author: Judiciary Committee
summary: This resolution proposes a revision to Rule XII regarding vacancy replacement in the Student Senate. It outlines the process for announcing and filling vacancies, including the involvement of the Replacement and Agenda Committee and the Information and Communication Committee. The committee will interview all applicants for vacant positions and make recommendations to the Senate. The goal of this revision is to ensure transparency and efficiency in filling Senate vacancies.

title: BUDGET AND APPROPRIATIONS CRITERIA OF REVIEW ACT (BACORA)
author: Senator Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: The Budget and Appropriations Committee will consist of nine Senators named to the committee by the Senate, one of which will be the Committee Chair. The committee will also have a member of the Student Body appointed as the Budget and Appropriations Committee Clerk. The clerk will serve as the taker of minutes for the committee.

title: Freedom to Run Act
sponsor: Senator Raj Mia
author: Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez
summary: The Freedom to Run Act, authored by Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez, aims to amend the Election Qualification Act to provide greater freedom for candidates to run in student elections. The bill has Senator Raj Mia as its sponsor. If enacted, the bill will allow candidates more flexibility in meeting the qualifications necessary to run for student office. The goal of the bill is to promote inclusivity and ensure that all students have the opportunity to participate in the democratic process of student elections.

title: VOTING RECORD FORGIVENESS ACT (VRFA)
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Budget and Appropriations Chair Blake Cox, Information and Communications Chair Ethan Ghozali, Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Senator Matt Reich, Senator Zoe Richter, Senator Raj Mia, Judiciary Vice Chair Joaquin Marcelino
author: Rules and Ethics Chairwoman Lilliana Clark
summary: This resolution, titled the Voting Record Forgiveness Act (VRFA), proposes amendments to Rule IV to address the attendance of members. The chair of the Rules and Ethics Committee (or their designee) will call the roll of the Senate whenever necessary. The resolution aims to modernize and improve the voting record forgiveness process. It seeks to provide guidelines for excused absences, eliminate outdated language, and establish a clear process for members to request record forgiveness. Overall, the VRFA promotes transparency, accountability, and efficiency within the Student Senate.

title: New Senator Orientation Administration Act — Rules and Procedures Amendment

The amendments aim to update the procedures and responsibilities of the Information and Communication Committee. The sponsors of this resolution include Judiciary Chair Jonathan Stephens, Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez, Senate President Pro-Tempore Nathan McGinnis, Budget Chair Blake Cox, and Judiciary Vice Chair Joaquin Marcelino.

title: Expulsion Constitutional Alignment and Simplification Act (ECASA) - 300 Codes Revisions
sponsor: Judiciary Vice Chair Joaquin Marcelino
author: Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez
summary: The Expulsion Constitutional Alignment and Simplification Act (ECASA) - 300 Codes Revisions, authored by Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez and sponsored by Judiciary Vice Chair Joaquin Marcelino, aims to streamline and simplify the process of expelling student senators. It includes provisions for filing written charges and outlines the procedure for expulsion in cases of failure to complete constituency requirements.

title: EXECUTIVE NOMINATION CLARIFICATION ACT — 200 CODES REVISIONS
sponsor: Judiciary Vice Chair Joaquin Marcelino
author: Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand
summary: The EXECUTIVE NOMINATION CLARIFICATION ACT — 200 CODES REVISIONS bill, authored by Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand and sponsored by Judiciary Vice Chair Joaquin Marcelino, proposes revisions to Chapter 210 of the EXECUTIVE BRANCH OFFICIALS ESTABLISHMENT AND ACCOUNTABILITY ACT. These revisions clarify the roles and responsibilities of the Executive Branch Officials within the student government at the University of Florida.

title: Voter Record Revision Act
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Senator Michael Lim, Senator Zoe Richter, Senate President Pro Tempore Nathan McGinnis, Judiciary Vice Chair Joaquin Marcelino
author: Deputy Majority Party Leader Navya Nair
summary: This bill, titled the Voter Record Revision Act, is authored by Deputy Majority Party Leader Navya Nair and sponsored by Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Senator Michael Lim, Senator Zoe Richter, Senate President Pro Tempore Nathan McGinnis, and Judiciary Vice Chair Joaquin Marcelino. The bill proposes amendments to Rule VII of the Student Senate's voting procedures. The standard voting procedure for all votes requiring a majority will be by voice, while votes requiring a two-thirds, two-fifths, or one-fifth majority will be done by rising vote. The bill aims to streamline and clarify the voting process in the Student Senate.

title: Graduate and Professional Student Summer Vacancy Resolution
author: Nathan McGinnis
summary: On Sunday, I received veto messages for 4 bills that were passed under second readings by the Student Senate. These vetoed pieces of legislation will be heard on Tuesday night under third readings. Legislation under third readings requires a two-thirds vote to override the veto. If an override vote fails, the veto is sustained, and the bill does not go into effect.

title: SSB 2023-1064: Graduate and Professional Student Summer Vacancy R
summary: On Sunday, I received veto messages for 4 bills that were passed under second readings by the Student Senate. These vetoed pieces of legislation will be heard on Tuesday night under third readings. Legislation under third readings requires a two-thirds vote to override the veto. If an override vote fails, the veto is sustained, and the bill does not go into effect.

title: The Budget Deliberation Act - 800 CODES REVISIONS
author: Senator Raj Mia
summary: The Budget Deliberation Act aims to make revisions to the 800 CODES, specifically Chapter 821, which governs the Big Five Budget Preparation Law. This law has undergone multiple amendments in the past. The Act's objective is to ensure transparency and efficiency in the budget preparation process. It specifically addresses the Activity and Service Fee Budget, which encompasses Recreational Sports, J. Wayne Reitz Union, Student Activities, and other areas. The Act aims to streamline the budget deliberation process and ensure that student funds are allocated appropriately.

title: General Body Meeting Transparency Act — 800 CODES REVISIONS

author: Senator Raj Mia
summary: The General Body Meeting Transparency Act — 800 CODES REVISIONS bill, authored by Senator Raj Mia, aims to revise Chapter 810 of the Administrative Provisions — Activity and Service Fee Usage Regulations. The bill has multiple sponsors including Budget and Appropriations Chairman Blake Cox, Budget and Appropriations Vice-Chairman John Brinkman, Senator Kinggard, Senator Ganghano, Senator Alvarez, Senator Lasch, and Member-At-Large Ponce. The bill's objective is to ensure transparency in general body meetings and the proper usage of the Student Activity and Service Fee to benefit the Student Body.

title: CROA - STUDENT GOVERNMENT COMPLIANCE ACT — 800 CODES REVISION
sponsor: Senator Zoe Richter, Senator Michael Lim, Senator Raj Mia, Deputy Majority Party Leader Navya Nair
author: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: This bill, titled CROA - STUDENT GOVERNMENT COMPLIANCE ACT — 800 CODES REVISION, is authored by Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens. The bill aims to revise Chapter 804 of the Student Government Printing codes, which includes regulations for printed and publicity materials such as brochures, pamphlets, posters, advertisements, programs, handbills, and stationery. The bill is sponsored by Senator Zoe Richter, Senator Michael Lim, Senator Raj Mia, and Deputy Majority Party Leader Navya Nair.

title: STUDENT GOVERNMENT FOOD EXPENDITURES EXPANSION & DENOTION (SG FEED) ACT
sponsor: Senator Michael Lim, Senator Navya Nair, Senator Raj Mia, Budget and Appropriations Chairman Blake Cox
author: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens

author: Budget and Appropriations Chair Blake Cox
summary: All student organizations that act i

title: TRAVEL SPECIFICATION OF DEFINITIONS ACT (TSODA) — 800 CODES REVISION
author: Budget and Appropriations Chair Blake Cox
summary: This bill, authored by Budget and Appropriations Chair Blake Cox, aims to revise the travel specification of definitions act (TSODA) in the 800 codes. The bill focuses on reimbursing expenses related to travel beyond UF's campus, excluding programming events held off campus. The objective is to provide clarity and guidelines for travel reimbursement for UF students.

title: Clerical Addendum Clarification (CAC)
author: Budget & Appropriations Vice-Chairman John Brinkman
summary: This bill, titled Clerical Addendum Clarification (CAC), is authored by Budget & Appropriations Vice-Chairman John Brinkman. The bill pertains to Chapter 800 Finances Generally and Chapter 804 Student Government Printing. It aims to clarify the clerical addendum process within these chapters. The bill does not mention any sponsors.

title: Event Budget Request Clarification (EBRC)
author: Budget & Appropriations Vice-Chairman John Brinkman
summary: This bill proposes event budget request clarification to ensure accurate and transparent use of student activity and service fees.

title: Honorarium Clarification Act (HCA)
author: Budget & Appropriations Vice-Chairman John Brinkman
summary: The Honorarium Clarification Act (HCA) is a bill authored by Budget & Appropriations Vice-Chairman John Brinkman. It aims to clarify and define the terms related to the use of student body funds, specifically the Activity & Service Fees. The bill provides definitions for Student Body Funds and Activity & Service Fees and outlines that the fees should be expended for lawful purposes that benefit the student body. The HCA seeks to bring clarity and transparency to the allocation and use of student funds.

title: Photographer Limit Clarification (PLC)
author: Budget & Appropriations Vice-Chairman John Brinkman
summary: Student Senate Bill 2023-1079, titled Photographer Limit Clarification (PLC), is authored by Budget & Appropriations Vice-Chairman John Brinkman. The bill clarifies the usage regulations of the Activity and Service Fees, as outlined in Chapter 810 Administrative Provisions. The Student Activity and Service Fee will be expended for lawful purposes to benefit the Student Body in general, in compliance with Florida Statute and Student Body Law. The Student Senate Budget and Appropriations Committee will recommend the allocation of the Activity and Service Fees to the Student Senate.

title: Amendments to the Agenda Senator Protection Act (AASPA)
sponsor: Senator Colin Lasch, Senator Matt Reich, Senator Wavid Bowman, Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan, Senator Michael Lim
author: Budget and Appropriations Chairman Blake Cox
summary: Amendments to the Agenda Senator Protection Act (AASPA) proposes changes to Rule III of the Senate's Meetings. The regular meetings will be conducted on campus at a consistent time and location. The time and location for regular meetings will be set by the Replacement and Agenda Committee at the beginning of each academic term, with the decision subject to a majority vote of the Senate.

title: Roll Call Quorum Check Clarification Act (RCQCCA)
sponsor: Senate President Pro-Tempore Nathan McGinnis
author: Senate President Santiago Perez
summary: This bill, titled Roll Call Quorum Check Clarification Act (RCQCCA), is authored by Senate President Santiago Perez and sponsored by Senate President Pro-Tempore Nathan McGinnis. It aims to clarify the procedures for roll call and quorum checks in Senate meetings. The bill specifies that the Chair of the Rules and Ethics Committee (or Vice-Chair in the Chair's absence) or their designee will call the roll of the Senate whenever needed. If no members of the Rules and Ethics Committee are present, the Senate President may designate a Senator to perform the roll call. The roll call will occur at the start of every meeting and after every recess. The bill aims to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of roll call and quorum checks in Senate meetings.

title: Quorum Check Expediency and Suspension Act
author: Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez
summary: This bill, titled the Quorum Check Expediency and Suspension Act, is authored by Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez. The bill aims to address the suspension and amendment of the rules in the Senate. It states that the rules may be suspended by a two-thirds vote, provided that no question is pending. However, certain rules cannot be suspended under any circumstances. The bill seeks to ensure efficiency and expediency in Senate proceedings.

title: Chair Roll Call Vote Clarification (CRCVC) Act
author: Senate President Oscar Santiago
summary: This resolution proposes the Chair Roll Call Vote Clarification (CRCVC) Act to clarify the rules regarding roll call votes in the Student Senate. The act specifies that a roll call vote can be ordered by a majority of the Senators present and voting before the next question is spoken on. The roll call will be conducted in accordance with the established rules, with the Chair of the Senate being called last. Senators are allowed to abstain from voting in cases of conflict of interest.

title: Oath of Office Act - 100 Codes Revision
sponsor: Senator Anghelo Gangano, Senator Raj Mia
author: Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez
summary: All elected Student Body Officials shall be required to take an oath of office as established within this chapter. The Student Senate President and the Student Senate Pro-Tempore shall take this oath of office upon election to their position. Student Senators-elect shall take this oath in the first meeting following the validation of the election results after quorum has been established. The Student Body President-elect, Student Body Vice President-elect and the Student Body Treasurer-elect will take this oath during the Student Government Banquet or on the first day t

Marcelino, Senator Eric Oh, Senator Anghelo Gangano, Senator Zoe Nye, Information and Communications Vice-Chair Monish Vijayaraghavan, Senator Jeff John, Mental Health Ad-Hoc Chairperson Wavid Bowman, Senator Kishan Nayak, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Senator Ayesha Khuddus, Senator Anamika Naidu, Senator Aron Ali-McClory, Senato
author: Senator Laurie Wang
summary: Resolution Condemning Florida Board of Governors’ Decision to Ban Asian Social Media Platforms at Public Universities

title: A Resolution Recognizing the Outstanding Efforts of Jerome Scott II
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Matthew Reich, Senator Laurie Wang, Senator Saketh Damera, Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez
author: Senator Raj Mia
summary: The University of Florida Student Senate recognizes the crucial role played by the Office of Student Government Advising and Operations in ensuring the smooth functioning of the student government. The University of Florida Student Senate acknowledges the dedicated and outstanding efforts of Jerome Scott II, the Associate Director of Student Government Advising and O

title: Office Hour Transparency Act – 200 CODES REVISIONS
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino
author: Senator Raj Mia
summary: The Office Hour Transparency Act proposes revisions to Chapter 210 of the Student Senate's Executive Branch Officials Establishment Act. The act establishes that the Executive Branch Officials are accountable to the Student Body President, Vice President, and Treasurer. The act also designates the Executive Secretaries as secretaries to the Student Body President on public policy matters.

title: Roll Call Clarity & Transparency Act – 000 Rules & Procedures Amendment
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino
author: Senator Raj Mia
summary: This bill, authored by Senator Raj Mia and sponsored by Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, proposes an amendment to Rule IV of the Student Senate's Rules & Procedures. The amendment aims to improve roll call procedures by clarifying that the Chair of the Rules and Ethics Committee (or Vice-Chair in the Chair's absence) or their designee will call the roll of the Senate, and if none are present, the Senate President may designate a Senator to do so. Roll call will occur at the start of every meeting, after every recess, and for any quorum call or roll call vote. Failure to answer a roll call or quorum call will be subject to disciplinary action and may result in a recorded absence.

title: Senate Liaisons Expansion Act
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Saketh Damera, Senator Matthew Reich
author: Senator Raj Mia
summary: The Senate Liaisons Expansion Act, authored by Senator Raj Mia, aims to expand the number of Senate Liaisons to the other branches of Student Government and University auxiliaries. The President of the Senate will have the authority to appoint Senate Liaisons, who must hold Senate seats. The Senate Liaisons will serve at the discretion of the President of the Senate and will meet with the President at their convenience. This act enhances communication and collaboration between the Student Senate and other branches of Student Government and University auxiliaries.

title: Senate Secretaries Responsibility Addition Act– 100 CODES
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Matthew Reich, Senator Laurie Wang, Senator Saketh Damera
author: Senator Raj Mia
summary: 100.213 The Senate Secretaries shall maintain an updated Microsoft Word document for each code chapter conducive for editing purposes. A copy of the Microsoft Word documents may be forwarded to a senator at their request.

title: THE FAIR ELECTION REFORM ACT – 700 CODES
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino
author: Senator Raj Mia
summary: This bill, titled THE FAIR ELECTION REFORM ACT - 700 CODES, proposes revisions to Chapter 710 - THE SUPERVISOR OF ELECTIONS ACT. The revisions include keeping all polling locations open from 8:30 AM to 9:00 PM on each designated day of the election, and ensuring that all students in line by 8:30 PM are allowed to vote.

title: Election Commission Accountability Act - 700 Codes Revision
sponsor: Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez, Senator Raj Mia, Majority Party Leader Simone Liang, Senator Anthony Hockman, Judiciary Vice-Chair
author: Senator Hunter Monson
summary: The Election Commission Accountability Act - 700 Codes Revision, authored by Senator Hunter Monson, proposes revisions to Chapter 720, The Election Commission Act. The bill aims to ensure accountability by requiring the Elections Commission to keep a written record of all meetings and hearings, including evidence, testimony, findings, and rulings. The bill also establishes a timeline of forty-eight (48) hours for the submission of the written record. The sponsors of the bill include Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez, Senator Raj Mia, Majority Party Leader Simone Liang, Senator Anthony Hockman, and Judiciary Vice-Chair.

title: THE SGP AND ACCENT INTEGRITY, NEGOTIATION AND TRANSPARENCY (SAINT) ACT
sponsor: Senator Antonio Hendricks, Majority Party Leader Simone Liang, Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand
author: Senator Raj Mia, Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: Student Government Productions, as an agency of Student Government, shall operate under the authority of the Student Body President who shall be empowered to remove from positions those individuals guilty of malfeasance, misfeasance, or nonfeasance.

title: The Senate Profiles Electronically Logged for Legislators (SPELL) Act
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Anghelo Gangano
author: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: The Senate Profiles Electronically Logged for Legislators (SPELL) Act is a Student Senate bill proposed by Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens. The bill aims to ensure the operation of a roster on the Student Government Website that lists all currently sitting Senators and related vacancies within the University of Florida Student Senate. Each Student Senator's affiliation will be presented next to their name, and they have the option to provide additional information for inclusion on the website. The SPELL Act seeks to enhance transparency and accessibility within the Student Senate.

title: The Pending Acts, Rules and Mandates (PARM) Act
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Anghelo Gangano
author: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens
summary: The Senate President shall ensure that the public voting records of Student Senators for all votes on the main question of bills, resolutions, nominations, and appointments are placed online, and that the attendance records of all Student Senators are placed online. Additionally, Senate Secretaries will ensure that Meeting Minute records are placed online. These records shall be posted online within one week of their creation.

title: Funding for Fiscal Year 2024-2025 Activity and Service Fee Budget
sponsor: Budget and Appropriations Committee
author: Budget and Appropriations Chairman Blake Cox
summary: This bill, authored by Budget and Appropriations Chairman Blake Cox, seeks to allocate funding for the Fiscal Year 2024-2025 activity and service fee budget. The total budget for this period is $24,054,701, which includes allocations for Recreational Sports, Reitz Union, Sorority & Fraternity Life, Student Activities & Involvement, and Student Government. The specific breakdown for the Recreational Sports budget includes $6,372,767 for personnel, $857,145 for operations, and $494,764 for ten-year plans.

title: Debate Consideration Reform (DCR) - Rules and Procedures Amendment
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino
author: Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez
summary: Senate Bill 2023-1116 proposes an amendment to Rule VI of the Rules Governing Debate. The bill suggests that readings of bills will be by title only, unless specifically requested by a majority of those present and voting. The authors and sponsors of the bill will be given five minutes to present their case, followed by a debate on the bill. The bill aims to streamline the debate process and ensure efficient consideration of bills.

title: Resolution Supporting the Creation of an Institute of Asian Pacific Islander and Desi Culture
sponsor: Pan-Asian Caucus Chairperson Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Member-at-Large Johnny Liu, Senator Laurie Wang, Senator Samantha Kinggard, Senator Elsa Brantmeyer, Information & Communications Chairman Ethan Ghozali, Senator Julia Seifer, Senator Ayesha Khuddus, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Senator Matthew Reich, Senator Bryan Garcia-Ramos, Senator Chalisa Budhai, Senator Anamika Naidu, Senator Nima Aria, Senator Anghelo Gangano, Senator Raj Mia
author: Senator Saketh Damera, Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan
summary: Resolution Supporting the Creation of an Institute of Asian Pacific Islander and Desi Culture

title: Resolution Advocating for the University of Florida to Make Election Day a Holiday
sponsor: Senator Chalisa Budhai, Senator Raj Mia, Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez
author: Senator Christian Rodriguez
summary: The Resolution Advocating for the University of Florida to Make Election Day a Holiday acknowledges the low voter turnout in the United States and the need for increased participation in elections. It highlights that the United States has one of the lowest voter turnout rates among developed countries. The resolution urges the University of Florida to recognize the importance of democracy and civic engagement by making Election Day a holiday. By making Election Day a holiday, the University can encourage students, faculty, and staff to exercise their right to vote and participate in the democratic process. This initiative aims to increase voter turnout and create a more engaged and informed community.

title: Constituent Transparency Act — Rules and Procedures Codes Revision
sponsor: Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Information and Communication Chairman Ethan Ghozali, Senator Julia Seifer, Member at Large Johnny Liu
author: Senator Samantha Kinggard
summary: This bill, titled the Constituent Transparency Act - Rules and Procedures Codes Revision, is authored by Senator Samantha Kinggard. The bill aims to revise the rules and procedures codes to improve constituent transparency. The sponsors of the bill include Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Information and Communication Chairman Ethan Ghozali, Senator Julia Seifer, and Member at Large Johnny Liu. The bill proposes amendments to Rule XI, which governs the standing committees of the Senate. Specifically, it focuses on the Information and Communication Committee, which is composed of nine Senators. This bill seeks to enhance transparency and communication within the Student Senate.

title: Resolution Condemning Florida House Bill 1069 and the Censorship, Restriction, and Removal of Educational Resources from Florida Schools
sponsor: Majority Party Leader Simone Liang, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Bryan Garcia-Ramos, Senator Anamika Naidu, Senator Christian Rodriguez, Senator Chalisa Budhai, Senator Antonio Hendricks, Senator Cec Wood-Barron, Senator Colin Lasch, Senate President Pro Tempore Nathan McGinnis, Senator Hunter Monson, Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez
author: Senator Anghelo Gangano
summary: On June 8th, 2023, President Joe Biden announced the appointment of a new point person at the Department of Education to address an increase in book bans. The American Library Association reported in 2022 that there has been a significant increase in incidents of book censorship and removal of educational resources in schools across the country. This resolution condemns Florida House Bill 1069 and the censorship, restriction, and removal of educational resources from Florida schools. The Student Senate believes that the free exchange of ideas and access to diverse educational resources are fundamental to a well-rounded education. The Student Senate urges the Florida House of Representatives to reject House Bill 1069 and to support policies that promote intellectual freedom and academic integrity in Florida schools.

title: Senate Newsletter Act - Rules and Procedures Amendment
sponsor: Senator Chalisa Budhai, Senate President Pro-Tempore Nathan McGinnis, Senator Anghelo Gangano, Senator Bryan Garcia-Ramos, Judiciary Chairperson Jonathan Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin Marcelino, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Hunter Monson, Senator Cec Wood-Barron, Senator Aron Ali-McClory, Senator Antonio Hendricks, Senator John Rassel, Senator Kishan Nayak, Senator Ana Alvarez
author: Majority Party Leader Simone Liang
summary: UF UNIVERSITY of FLORIDA Student Senate presents the Senate Newsletter Act - Rules and Procedures Amendment. The bill, authored by Majority Party Leader Simone Liang, is sponsored by multiple senators including Chalisa Budhai, Nathan McGinnis, Anghelo Gangano, Bryan Garcia-Ramos, Jonathan Stephens, Joaquin Marcelino, Raj Mia, Hunter Monson, Cec Wood-Barron, Aron Ali-McClory, Antonio Hendricks, John Rassel, Kishan Nayak, and Ana Alvarez. The amendment focuses on Rule XI, which pertains to the standing committees of the Senate. The purpose of this amendment is to update and improve the rules and procedures related to the Senate Newsletter. The Student Senate aims for better communication and transparency through this proposed amendment.

title: Resolution Addressing the Environmental Risks Associated with Phosphate Mining and Phosphogypsum Storage in the State of Florida
sponsor: Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez, Senate President Pro Tempore Nathan McGinnis, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Anghelo Gangano, Senator Samantha Kinggard, Senator Julia Seifer, Senator Eric Oh, Senator Saketh Damera, Senator Isabel Ponce, Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Deputy Majority Party Leader Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Kaavya Polavarapu, Senator Julian Villarta, Senator Danielle Haddad, Senator Vivianett Avila, Senator Laurel Wentwo
author: Senator Zoe Richter
summary: Resolution Addressing the Environmental Risks Associated with Phosphate Mining and Phosphogypsum Storage in the State of Florida

title: Resolution Addressing the Need for Charging Stations in the Reitz Union
sponsor: Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Senator Laurie Wang, Senator Amanda Lieber, Senator Saketh Damera, Member at Large Johnny Liu, Senator Ayesha Khuddus, Budget and Appropriations Chairman Blake Cox, Member at Large Isabel Ponce, Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand
author: Senator Julia Seifer, Samantha Kinggard
summary: The J. Wayne Reitz Union is a multifaceted hub of student life on campus that enhances the Gator student experience by creating purposeful, proactive, and unique opportunities for learning, leadership, and education.

title: Resolution Addressing the Need for Physical Directories to Essential Locations on Campus
sponsor: Rules and Ethics Chairwoman Lilliana Clark, Senator Laurie Wang, Budget and Appropriations Chairman Blake Cox, Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Member at Large Johnny Liu, Member at Large Isabel Ponce
author: Senator Julia Seifer, Senator Samantha Kinggard
summary: The University of Florida Student Senate proposes a resolution to address the need for physical directories to essential locations on campus. With a population of 55,781 students, many of whom live on campus or in surrounding areas, the university's campus spans 22 acres of land. A physical directory would provide a quick and convenient reference for students to locate important buildings and resources on campus. The resolution is supported by Senator Julia Seifer, Senator Samantha Kinggard, and sponsored by Rules and Ethics Chairwoman Lilliana Clark, Senator Laurie Wang, Budget and Appropriations Chairman Blake Cox, Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Member at Large Johnny Liu, and Member at Large Isabel Ponce.

title: Religious Absences Expungement Consideration (RAEC) Act - 300 Codes Revision
author: Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez
summary: During the Summer A and Summer B terms, if a Student Senator accumulates two (2) unexcused or three (3) combined absences (excused or unexcused) from the Student Senate, it shall constitute resignation by non-attendance. During the Fall and Spring terms, if a Student Senator accumulates more than two unexcused or three combined absences, they shall be considered a resignation from the Student Senate.

title: Proposal to Eliminate the Defunct Student Honor Court - Constitutional Amendment
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin Rafaele C. Marcelino, Senator Matthew Reich, Senator Saketh Damera, Senator Laurie Wang
author: Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez
summary: Proposal to eliminate the defunct Student Honor Court by amending the Student Body Constitution. The amendment includes striking sections 4 and 5 of Article V and section 2(c) of Article V. This amendment will be submitted to the electors for ratification or rejection at the general election in Spring 2024.

title: Fall 2023 Apportionment Realignment Act (FARA)
sponsor: Majority Party Leader Simone Liang, Senator Aron Ali-McClory, Senator Raj Mia
author: Ad-Hoc Committee On Fall 2023 Apportionment Realignment
summary: This bill, known as the Fall 2023 Apportionment Realignment Act (FARA), aims to realign the apportionment for the Fall 2023 session. It is authored by the Ad-Hoc Committee On Fall 2023 Apportionment Realignment, with sponsorship from Majority Party Leader Simone Liang, Senator Aron Ali-McClory, and Senator Raj Mia. The bill proposes changes to Chapter 322 Apportionment, covering various previous acts such as 67-107, 72-118, 72-172, and many others. The goal of this bill is to ensure fair and accurate apportionment for the Fall 2023 session.

title: An Act Enumerating Student Government Services - 500 Codes Revision
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino
author: Mental Health Committee Co-Chair Wavid Bowman
summary: CHAPTER 503 - STUDENT GOVERNMENT SERVICES. 503.1 "Student Government Service" is defined as a subsidiary Student Government organization which provides services that promote enrichment in safety, entertainment, health, professional skills and personal development. 503.2 Student Government Services enumerated in section 503.5 are not intended to be a complete list of Student Government Services. 503.3 The funding for Student Government Services will be decided in the Activities and Service Fees Budget.

title: The Absentee Ballot Information and Accountability Act
sponsor: Senator Chalisa Budhai, Senator Asif Islam, Majority Party Leader Simone Liang, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Anghelo Gangano, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Aron Ali-McClory
author: Senator Christian Rodriguez
summary: The Absentee Ballot Information and Accountability Act, authored by Senator Christian Rodriguez, seeks to amend Chapter 710 - The Supervisor of Elections Act. The bill aims to enhance the absentee ballot process by imposing stricter accountability measures. The proposed amendments include provisions for increased transparency, improved voter education, and more stringent requirements for absentee ballot application and verification. By enacting this act, the Student Senate aims to ensure the integrity and efficiency of the absentee voting system within the university.

title: The Accountability of Acts Act (AAA)
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Chalisa Budhai
author: Senator Christian Rodriguez
summary: The Accountability of Acts Act (AAA) is a bill authored by Senator Christian Rodriguez. The bill aims to amend Rule XI, which governs the standing committees of the Student Senate. Specifically, it focuses on the Replacement and Agenda Committee, outlining its composition and responsibilities. The committee will include the Senate President Pro Tempore as chair, the Senate President, the leaders of each political party or coalition, two Senate Members-At-Large, and a member of the Student Body. The AAA bill seeks to enhance accountability and efficiency in the Student Senate's committee structure.

title: The Supreme Court Syllabus Act
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Chalisa Budhai
author: Senator Christian Rodriguez
summary: The Student Senate enacts the Supreme Court Syllabus Act to authorize the creation of syllabi that simplify complex Supreme Court opinions and make them more accessible to the student body.

title: THE FREEDOM OF ELECTION DATA (FED) ACT – 700 CODES REVISIONS
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Bryan Garcia-Ramos, Senator Asif Islam, Senator Kaavya Polavarapu, Senator Anghelo Gangano, Senator Christian Rodriguez, Majority Party Leader Simone Liang, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Cec Wood-Barron
author: Senator Anamika Naidu
summary: The Freedom of Election Data (FED) Act proposes revisions to Chapter 760 - The Election Campaign Act. The act aims to enhance the freedom and integrity of elections by modifying 700 codes related to election campaigns. The bill is authored by Senator Anamika Naidu and sponsored by Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens and others. The revisions aim to improve the transparency, fairness, and accuracy of election data. The act will be an important step towards ensuring a democratic electoral process.

title: Resolution Advocating for Greater Civic Engagement Initiatives for Students at the University of Florida
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Chalisa Budhai, Senator Christian Rodriguez, Senator Anthony Hockman, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Anamika Naidu, Senator Kaavya Polavarapu
author: Majority Party Leader Simone Liang
summary: The Student Senate Bill 2023-1142, titled 'Resolution Advocating for Greater Civic Engagement Initiatives for Students at the University of Florida,' encourages students to actively participate in addressing community issues. The resolution highlights civic engagement as actions taken by individuals such as voting, volunteering, and activism. By promoting community decision-making and fostering democratic processes, civic engagement contributes to a stronger and more inclusive community at the University of Florida.

title: Committee Recording Transparency Act (CRTA) - Rules and Procedures Amendment
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino Senator Christian Rodriguez, Senator Anamika Naidu
author: Majority Party Leader Simone Liang
summary: Amendment to Rule XI of the Student Senate's Standing Committees of the Senate. The amendment requires the Replacement and Agenda Committee to announce all open chair positions of standing committees in their report to the Senate. Senators seeking the Chair of a standing committee must submit a request for consideration. The amendment aims to bring transparency to the process of appointing Chairs of standing committees.

Senate Rules and Procedures shall not overrule any guidelines enumerated herein or elsewhere within Student Body Statutes.
