title: AUTHORIZATION ORDERING SENATE BUDGETARY FUNDS TOWARDS ESTABLISHING THE EMERGENCY CONTRACEPTIVE VENDING MACHINE PROJECT
sponsor: Mental Health Co-Chairperson Wavid Bowman, Senator Asif Islam, Senator Anamika Naidu, Senator Anghelo Gangano
author: Senator Isabella Scramoncin
summary: Students at the University of Florida have demanded for many years the installation of a contraceptive vending machine on campus to support students' reproductive rights. With 57% of undergraduate students being females, this project aims to address the need for accessible contraceptives. The Student Senate is authorizing the allocation of budgetary funds towards establishing the Emergency Contraceptive Vending Machine Project.

title: AUTHORIZATION ORDERING SENATE BUDGETARY FUNDS TOWARDS ESTABLISHING THE STUDENT GOVERNMENT REGIONAL TRANSIT SYSTEM APPLICATION PROJECT
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Majority Party Leader Simone Liang, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Nima Aria, Senator Christian Rodriguez, Senator Anghelo Gangano, Senator Danielle Hadad, Mental Health Committee Co-Chair Wavid Bowman
author: Senator Asif Islam
summary: Many students at the University of Florida, and many residents who reside in Gainesville at large, have leveled complaints about the RTS (Regional Transit System) app for a number of reasons, including but not limited to: the fact that it is poorly optimized, it tends to crash a lot, and it is not functional on all devices

title: Resolution Advocating for Increased Access to Resources for Transfer Students at the University of Florida
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Matthew Reich, Senator Saketh Damara, Senator Laurie Wang
author: Senator Claudia Garcia
summary: Transfer students make up nearly 40 percent of all college students but often face barriers and lack access to resources. The University of Florida Student Senate recognizes the need to increase efforts in providing transfer students with access to resources, opportunities, and information. This resolution aims to advocate for improved access and awareness for transfer students at the University of Florida.

title: Resolution Addressing the Need for Crosswalks Across Southwest 35th Place and Southwest 23rd Street
sponsor: Senate President Pro-Tempore Nathan McGinnis, Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Majority Party Leader Simone Liang, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Chalisa Budhai, Senator Anghelo Gangano, Senator Saketh Damara
author: Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez
summary: WHEREAS, pedestrian safety has been an important effort for the University of Florida and Gainesville community; and, WHEREAS, the University of Florida Student Senate has approved multiple resolutions advocating for the development of crosswalks around campus and near student populations [1]; and, WHEREAS, Southwest 35th Place is a road adjacent t

title: Resolution Requesting Exercise Classes to Promote Mental Health and Wellness in Student Recreation Centers
sponsor: Member at Large Isabel Ponce, Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan, Senator Eric Oh, Senator Samantha Kinggard, Senator Laurie Wang, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Senator Saketh Damara, Senator Matthew Reich
author: Senator Jillian Sparkman, Senator Jordan Neidenberg
summary: Mental health issues have become increasingly prevalent among college students, with up to 44% of college students reported having symptoms of depression and anxiety. The COVID-19 pandemic has added to the stress and anxiety experienced by students, further emphasizing the importance of mental health support. Physical exercise has been scientifically proven to have positive effects on mental well-being, including reducing symptoms of depression and anxiety. This resolution requests the implementation of exercise classes in student recreation centers to promote mental health and wellness among college students. The classes would aim to provide accessible and diverse exercise options to cater to the diverse needs and preferences of students. By creating opportunities for students to engage in physical activity, the resolution aims to support their mental well-being and overall quality of life.

title: Resolution Advocating for Increased Outdoor Recreation Spaces for Students
sponsor: Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Senator Julia Seifer, Senator Claudia Garcia, Senator Samantha Kinggard, Senator Eric Oh, Senator Elsa Brantmeyer, Senator Saketh Damara, Senator Matthew Reich
author: Senator Nathan Patrick, Senator Paige Kleppe
summary: The University of Florida Student Senate recognizes the importance of outdoor recreation spaces in promoting physical fitness, mental well-being, and a sense of community among students and staff. As part of its commitment to creating a healthy and inclusive campus environment, the Student Senate advocates for increased outdoor recreation spaces. These spaces play a vital role in encouraging physical activity and fostering social interaction. By advocating for the expansion of outdoor recreation spaces, the Student Senate aims to enhance the overall well-being of the university community.

title: Resolution Recognizing the Need for Access to Hydration Resources on Campus
sponsor: Rules and Ethics Chairwoman Lilliana Clark, Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan, Senator Ayesha Khuddus, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Member at Large Isabel Ponce, Senator Samantha Kinggard, Senator Julia Seifer
author: Senator Paige Kleppe, Senator Elsa Brantmeyer
summary: Dehydration can lead to significant health problems, including fatigue, headaches, and decreased physical performance. Student athletes, recreational sports participants, and physically active individuals at the University of Florida require proper hydration to perform optimally and maintain their health. The resolution recognizes the need for access to hydration resources on campus to support the well-being and athletic performance of the UF community.

title: Resolution Advocating for the Expansion of University-Funded access to Paywall Blocked Resources for Students
sponsor: Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Member at Large Isabel Ponce, Senator Julia Seifer, Senator Samantha Kinggard
author: Senator Charlotte Russo, Senator Elsa Brantmeyer
summary: In today's rapidly changing global landscape, access to current events and the latest research is essential for a well-rounded education. Many reputable news outlets and academic journals restrict access to content behind paywalls, limiting the ability of students to engage with vital information. The University of Florida currently provides access to certain academic journals and resources, but does not e

title: Political Affiliation Realignment Technical Initiative (PARTI)
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Anghelo Gangano, Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Majority Party Leader Simone Liang
author: Senate President Pro Tempore Nathan McGinnis, Senator Raj Mia
summary: Amendment to Rule XVII: Political Parties. All new Senators must indicate their party affiliation when submitting their information forms to the Senate office. Senators may choose to affiliate with any political party that has participated won a seat in a Student Government.

title: Resolution Calling for the University of Florida to Inform Students of University Policies Which Allow Them to Observe Religious Holidays Without Fear of Academic Consequences
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Samantha Kinggard, Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Senator Laurie Wang, Member at Large Isabel Ponce, Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan, Senator Ayesha Khuddus, Senator Paige Kleppe, Senator Saketh Damara
author: Senator Julia Seifer, Senator Matthew Reich
summary: This resolution calls for the University of Florida to inform students of university policies that allow them to observe religious holidays without facing academic consequences. It was inspired by the advocacy of individuals, including Maya Idiculla. The resolution recognizes the importance of religious freedom and aims to ensure that students have the ability to practice their religious beliefs without fear of negative academic impacts.

title: Resolution Calling on University Administration to Donate Unused Flex Bucks to the Field and Fork Pantry
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Samantha Kinggard, Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Senator Laurie Wang, Member at Large Isabel Ponce, Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan, Senator Saketh Damara
author: Senator Julia Seifer, Senator Matthew Reich
summary: Food insecurity is defined as lacking consistent access to 'enough food for an active, healthy life,' largely resulting from inadequate financial resources for food. Food insecure individuals struggle with a multitude of overlapping issues, such as low income, lack of affordable housing, and health problems. To address this issue on campus, this resolution calls on the university administration to donate unused flex bucks from student meal plans to the Field and Fork Pantry. By redirecting these funds, the university can help provide food assistance to students facing food insecurity and contribute to a more inclusive and supportive campus community.

title: Resolution Requesting Student Legal Services to Assist Students with Immigration Services
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Rules and Ethics Chairwoman Lilliana Clark, Senator Samantha Kinggard, Senator Claudia Garcia, Senator Ayesha Khuddus, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Member at Large Isabel Ponce, Senator Elsa Brantmeyer, Senator Julia Seifer, Senator Laurie Wang, Senator Saketh Damara, Senator Matthew Reich
author: Senator Eric Oh, Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan
summary: The University of Florida Student Senate requests the assistance of Student Legal Services to provide support and services to international students regarding immigration matters. This resolution recognizes the significant contributions of international students to the campus community and acknowledges the challenges they often face in navigating complex immigration procedures. By providing access to legal resources, Student Legal Services aims to assist international students in their immigration needs and promote a more inclusive and supportive environment.

title: Resolution Condemning the Recent Decision to Ban AP Psychology in Florida Schools
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan, Senator Claudia Garcia, Senator Samantha Kinggard, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Member at Large Isabel Ponce, Senator Paige Kleppe, Senator Elsa Brantmeyer, Senator Saketh Damara, Senator Laurie Wang, Senator Matthew Reich
author: Gator Party Leader Bronson Allemand
summary: Advanced Placement (AP) courses provide students with opportunities to explore college-level studies while in high school, fostering skills needed for higher education. AP Psychology has been a part of Florida's high school curriculum for three decades, providing an essential understanding of human behavior and mental processes. However, the recent decision to ban AP Psychology in Florida schools undermines the academic progress and restricts the educational choices available to students. This resolution condemns the decision and advocates for the continuation of AP Psychology as an integral part of the high school curriculum in Florida.

title: Resolution Requesting Increased Accessibility of Football Tickets for Students
sponsor: Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan, Senator Claudia Garcia, Senator Samantha Kinggard, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Senator Elsa Brantmeyer, Senator Julia Seifer, Member at Large Isabel Ponce, Senator Eric Oh
author: Gator Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Senator Nathan Patrick
summary: Attending sporting events, such as football games, is an integral part of the university experience, fostering a sense of community and school spirit among students. Many students face financial constraints and challenges in acquiring tickets to football games, with limited availability making it difficult for many students to attend these events.

title: Resolution Requesting the Creation of a LGBTQ+ Institute
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Laurie Wang, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan
author: Minority Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Senator Julia Seifer
summary: The University of Florida Student Senate requests the creation of a LGBTQ+ Institute to support and empower LGBTQ+ students on campus. This institute aims to provide resources, programming, and a safe space for the LGBTQ+ community at UF. Building upon the existing institutes for Hispanic and Latinx culture, Black culture, and inclusion, the LGBTQ+ Institute will contribute to a diverse and inclusive campus environment. It symbolizes UF's commitment to fostering understanding, respect, and acceptance of all individuals, regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Senate Parliamentarian Modernization Act – 000 Codes Revision
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino
author: Gator Party Leader Bronson Allemand, Majority Party Leader Simone Liang
summary: Senate Parliamentarian Modernization Act – 000 Codes Revision aims to revise and modernize Rule I of the Student Senate, which governs the officers of the Senate. The bill proposes amendments to improve the appointment process of the Senate Parliamentarian. The President of the Student Senate has the authority to appoint the Senate Parliamentarian, and if the office becomes vacant, the President Pro Tempore will perform the duties. The bill also ensures that the Senate Parliamentarian is considered an exclusionary office in accordance with the Student Body Statutes. The objective of the bill is to enhance the functioning and efficiency of the Student Senate.

title: RESOLUTION FOR THE URGENT NEED TO ESTABLISH THE CREATIVE ARTS NEEDS AND VALUES ACCESSIBILITY SERVICES (CANVAS) PROJECT
sponsor: Majority Party Leader Simone Liang, Senator Zoe Richter, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Asif Islam, Senator Anghelo Gangano, Senator Anthony Hockman, Senator Julia Seifer, Budget Chairman Blake Cox, Senator Chalisa Budhai
author: Senator Cec Wood-Barron
summary: With reference to SSB 2022-1067- Resolution Addressing Professional Resources and Critical Needs for Arts Students at the University of Florida, written by former Senator Cassie Urbenz and Senator Evan E. Rafanan, the University of Florida’s Student Senate unanimously passed the bill stating “Student Senate advocates for further expansion and innovative programs to support the needs of the arts students at the University of Florida.” The Creative Arts Needs and Values Accessibility Services (CANVAS) Project aims to establish an accessible and inclusive environment that supports the unique needs of arts students at the University of Florida. The project focuses on providing resources, programs, and services that enhance the academic, social, and emotional well-being of arts students. The CANVAS project also aims to promote diversity, equity, and inclusion within the arts community at the University of Florida.

title: Resolution recognizing the need for Food Delivery Waivers during the Final Examination Period
sponsor: Senator Samantha Kinggard, Senator Claudia Garcia, Member at Large Isabel Ponce, Senator Julia Seifer, Senator Elsa Brantmeyer
author: Senator Monish Vijayaraghavan, Senator Ayesha Khuddus, Senator Owen Lekebusch, Senator Paige Kleppe
summary: Many university students fail to follow a well-balanced, consistent meal plan when preparing for their final exams. A survey conducted on stress in college displayed more than 89% of respondents said they felt stress from exams, and nearly 74% said studying brought them stress. Nutrition plays a vital role in the promotion of overall health and well-being, especially for indiv

title: Resolution Advocating for the Implementation of the Federal Open Textbook Pilot Program at the University of Florida
sponsor: Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino
author: Senator Matthew Reich, Senator Ryan Harrell
summary: As of 2022, the average college textbook costs an estimated $105.37. One-quarter of students reported having to work extra hours to pay for their textbooks. The Federal Open Textbook Pilot program aims to support projects at institutions of higher education that create and expand the use of open textbooks to achieve savings for students.

title: A Resolution Condemning the Practice of Conversion Therapy
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Senator Anghelo Gangano, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Chalisa Budhai, Senator Nima Aria, Senator Cec Wood-Barron
author: LGBTQ+ Caucus Chairperson & Judiciary Vice Chair Joaquin R. C. Marcelino, Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez
summary: The Student Senate condemns the practice of conversion therapy, which involves attempts to change an individual's sexual orientation or sexual behaviors, including their gender identity. Such practices may include aversive conditioning methods and psychotherapy techniques. The American Medical Association has recognized that conversion therapy is not effective and poses significant risks to the mental and physical health of those subjected to it. The Senate acknowledges the importance of upholding the rights and well-being of LGBTQ+ individuals and advocates for the banning of conversion therapy nationwide.

title: Resolution Advocating for the Consideration of a New Crosswalk Across Gale Lemerand Drive Near the New Physics Building
sponsor: Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Matthew Reich, Senator Saketh Damara, Senator Laurie Wang
author: Senator Bryan Garcia-Ramos
summary: The City of Gainesville has experienced incidents of pedestrian injury and fatality. In 2021, Alachua County reported 161 motor vehicle crashes involving pedestrians, resulting in 122 injuries and 12 fatalities. This resolution advocates for the consideration of a new crosswalk across Gale Lemerand Drive near the New Physics Building to improve pedestrian safety. The sponsor list includes Judiciary Chair Jonathan C. Stephens, Judiciary Vice-Chair Joaquin R.C. Marcelino, Senator Matthew Reich, Senator Saketh Damara, and Senator Laurie Wang.

title: A Resolution Condemning the Actions and Rhetoric of Florida Governor Ron DeSantis
sponsor: Senate President Oscar Santiago Perez, Senate President Pro Tempore Nathan McGinnis, Judiciary Chairperson Jonathan Chance Stephens, Majority Party Leader Simone Liang, Deputy Majority Party Leader Joaquin R. C. Marcelino, Senator Hunter Monson, Senator Cec Wood-Barron, Senator Asif Islam, Senator Anghelo Gangano, Senator Zoe Richter, Senator Aron Ali-McClory, Senator Bryan Garcia-Ramos, Senator Isabella Scramoncin, Senator Raj Mia, Senator Danielle Haddad, Senator Ryan Athay
author: Senator Christian Isaiah Rodriguez, Senator Chalisa Kalyani Budhai
summary: Ron DeSantis was elected to be the governor of Florida and represent the needs of all Floridians, but his actions and rhetoric have demonstrated a disregard for the values and principles that we hold dear. This resolution condemns his actions and rhetoric and calls for him to be held accountable for his divisive and harmful behavior. We urge the citizens of Florida to join us in speaking out against his actions and working towards a more inclusive and compassionate state.
